BuiltInExtension.name: getArucasVersion
desc: This is used to get the version of Arucas that is currently running

returns.desc: the version of Arucas that is currently running

BuiltInExtension.name: getMilliTime
desc: This is used to get the current time in milliseconds

BuiltInExtension.name: debug
desc: This is used to enable or disable debug mode

params.name: bool
params.desc: true to enable debug mode, false to disable debug mode

BuiltInExtension.name: runFromString
desc: This is used to evaluate a string as a script

params.name: string
params.desc: the string to evaluate

returns.desc: the return value of the script

BuiltInExtension.name: getNanoTime
desc: This is used to get the current time in nanoseconds

BuiltInExtension.name: getTime
desc: This is used to get the current time formatted with HH:mm:ss in your local time

returns.desc: the current time formatted with HH:mm:ss

BuiltInExtension.name: isMain
desc: This is used to check whether the script is the main script

returns.desc: true if the script is the main script, false if it is not

BuiltInExtension.name: throwRuntimeError
desc: This is used to throw a runtime error

params.name: message
params.desc: the message of the error

BuiltInExtension.name: experimental
desc: This is used to enable or disable experimental mode

params.name: bool
params.desc: true to enable experimental mode, false to disable experimental mode

BuiltInExtension.name: run
desc: This is used to run a .arucas file, you can use on script to run other scripts

params.name: path
params.desc: as a file path

returns.desc: any value that the file returns

BuiltInExtension.name: getUnixTime
desc: This is used to get the current time in seconds since the Unix epoch

returns.desc: the current time in seconds since the Unix epoch

BuiltInExtension.name: sleep
desc: This pauses your program for a certain amount of milliseconds

params.name: milliseconds
params.desc: milliseconds to sleep

BuiltInExtension.name: random
desc: This is used to generate a random integer between 0 and the bound

params.name: bound
params.desc: the maximum bound (exclusive)

BuiltInExtension.name: input
desc: This is used to take an input from the user

params.name: prompt
params.desc: the prompt to show the user

BuiltInExtension.name: print
desc: This prints a number of values to the console

params.name: printValue...
params.desc: the value to print

BuiltInExtension.name: print
desc: This prints a value to the console

params.name: printValue
params.desc: the value to print

BuiltInExtension.name: len
desc: This is used to get the length of a collection or string

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection or string

BuiltInExtension.name: stop
desc: This is used to stop a script

BuiltInExtension.name: callFunctionWithList
desc: This is used to call a function with a list of arguments

params.name: function
params.desc: the function

params.name: list
params.desc: the list of arguments

returns.desc: the return value of the function

BuiltInExtension.name: suppressDeprecated
desc: This is used to enable or disable suppressing deprecation warnings

params.name: bool
params.desc: true to enable suppressing deprecation warnings, false to disable suppressing deprecation warnings

BuiltInExtension.name: getDate
desc: This is used to get the current date formatted with dd/MM/yyyy in your local time

returns.desc: the current date formatted with dd/MM/yyyy

Object.name: Object
desc: This is the base class for every other class in Arucas.

methods.name: hashCode
desc: This returns the hashcode of the value, this is mainly used for maps and sets

methods.name: equals
desc: This checks whether the value is equal to another value

params.name: other
params.desc: the other value you want to check against

methods.name: toString
desc: This returns the string representation of the value

returns.desc: the string representation of the value

methods.name: copy
desc: This returns a copy of the value, some values might just return themselves

methods.name: getValueType
desc: This returns the name of the type of the value

returns.desc: the name of the type of value

methods.name: instanceOf
desc: This checks whether this value is an instance of another type

params.name: type
params.desc: the other type you want to check against

returns.desc: whether the value is of that type

Type.name: Type
desc: This class lets you get the type of a class or value.

methods.name: getStaticMethod
desc: This gets the static method of the type

params.name: name
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters
params.desc: the number of parameters for the method

returns.desc: the static method of the type

methods.name: getName
desc: This gets the name of the type

methods.name: getConstructor
desc: This gets the constructor of the type

params.name: parameters
params.desc: the number of parameters for the constructor

methods.name: instanceOf
desc: This checks whether a type is a subtype of another type

params.name: type
params.desc: the other type you want to check against

returns.desc: whether the type is of that type

static_methods.name: of
desc: This gets the specific type of a value

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to get the type of

Enum.name: Enum
desc: All enums extends this class.

methods.name: getName
desc: This allows you to get the name of the enum value

returns.desc: the name of the enum value

methods.name: ordinal
desc: This allows you to get the ordinal of the enum value

returns.desc: the ordinal of the enum value

Function.name: Function
desc: Adds utilities for delegating and calling functions.

static_methods.name: call
desc: Calls the given delegate with the given arbitrary parameters

params.name: delegate
params.desc: the delegate to call

params.name: parameters...
params.desc: the parameters to pass to the delegate

returns.desc: the return value of the delegate

static_methods.name: getMethod
desc: Returns a method delegate with the given name and parameter count

params.name: value
params.desc: the value to call the method on

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameterCount
params.desc: the parameter count of the method

static_methods.name: callWithList
desc: Calls the given delegate with the given parameters

params.name: delegate
params.desc: the delegate to call

params.name: parameters
params.desc: the parameters to pass to the delegate

returns.desc: the return value of the delegate

static_methods.name: getBuiltIn
desc: Returns a built-in function delegate with the given name and parameter count

params.name: functionName
params.desc: the name of the function

params.name: parameterCount
params.desc: the parameter count of the function

String.name: String
desc: This class cannot be constructed since strings have a literal. Strings are immutable.

methods.name: uppercase
desc: This makes the string uppercase

methods.name: lowercase
desc: This makes the string lowercase

methods.name: format
desc: This formats the string with the given parameters, which replace '%s' in the string

params.name: values...
params.desc: the values to add, these will be converted to strings

throws: You are missing values to be formatted

methods.name: toList
desc: This makes a list of all the characters in the string

methods.name: matches
desc: This checks if the string matches the given regex

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex to check the string with

returns.desc: true if the string matches the given regex

methods.name: replaceAll
desc: This replaces all the instances of a regex with the replace string

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex you want to replace

params.name: replace
params.desc: the string you want to replace it with

methods.name: capitalise
desc: This capitalises the first letter of the string

methods.name: contains
desc: This checks if the string contains the given string

params.name: string
params.desc: the string you want to check for

returns.desc: true if the string contains the given string

methods.name: split
desc: This splits the string into a list of strings based on a regex

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex to split the string with

methods.name: strip
desc: This strips the whitespace from the string

methods.name: subString
desc: This returns a substring of the string

params.name: from
params.desc: the start index

params.name: to
params.desc: the end index

methods.name: find
desc: This finds all instances of the regex in the string

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex to search the string with

returns.desc: the list of all instances of the regex in the string

methods.name: endsWith
desc: This checks if the string ends with the given string

params.name: string
params.desc: the string to check the string with

returns.desc: true if the string ends with the given string

methods.name: toNumber
desc: This tries to convert the string to a number

methods.name: startsWith
desc: This checks if the string starts with the given string

params.name: string
params.desc: the string to check the string with

returns.desc: true if the string starts with the given string

Boolean.name: Boolean
desc: This class cannot be constructed since Booleans have literals.

Error.name: Error
desc: This class is the only type that can be thrown
This creates a new Error value with no message
This creates a new Error value with the given details as a message

params.name: details
params.desc: the details of the error

desc: This creates a new Error value with the given details as a message and the given value

params.name: details
params.desc: the details of the error

params.name: value
params.desc: the value that is related to the error

methods.name: getValue
desc: This returns the value that is related to the error

returns.desc: the value that is related to the error

methods.name: getDetails
desc: This returns the raw message of the error

methods.name: getFormattedDetails
desc: This returns the message of the error in a formatted string

List.name: List
desc: This class cannot be constructed since it has a literal, `[]`

methods.name: containsAll
desc: This allows you to check if the list contains all the values in a collection

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection you want to check for

returns.desc: true if the list contains all the values in the collection, false otherwise

methods.name: clear
desc: This allows you to clear all the values the list

methods.name: isEmpty
desc: This allows you to check if the list is empty

returns.desc: true if the list is empty, false otherwise

methods.name: insert
desc: This allows you to insert a value at a specific index

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to insert

params.name: index
params.desc: the index you want to insert the value at

methods.name: concat
desc: This allows you to concatenate two lists

params.name: otherList
params.desc: the list you want to concatenate with

methods.name: remove
desc: This allows you to remove the value at a specific index

params.name: index
params.desc: the index of the value you want to remove

methods.name: contains
desc: This allows you to check if the list contains a value

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to check for

returns.desc: true if the list contains the value, false otherwise

methods.name: addAll
desc: This allows you to add all the values in a collection to the list

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection you want to add

methods.name: get
desc: This allows you to get the value at a specific index

params.name: index
params.desc: the index of the value you want to get

methods.name: toString
desc: This converts the list to a string and evaluating any collections inside it

returns.desc: the string representation of the set

methods.name: indexOf
desc: This allows you to get the index of a value in the list

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to check for

returns.desc: the index of the value, -1 if the value is not in the list

methods.name: append
desc: This allows you to append a value to the end of the list

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to append

Set.name: Set
desc: Sets are collections of unique values. Similar to maps, without the values.
An instance of the class can be created by using `Set.of(values...)`

methods.name: add
desc: This allows you to add a value to the set

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to add to the set

returns.desc: whether the value was successfully added to the set

methods.name: contains
desc: This allows you to check whether a value is in the set

params.name: value
params.desc: the value that you want to check in the set

returns.desc: whether the value is in the set

methods.name: addAll
desc: This allows you to add all the values in a collection into the set

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection of values you want to add

methods.name: containsAll
desc: This allows you to check whether a collection of values are all in the set

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection of values you want to check in the set

returns.desc: whether all the values are in the set

methods.name: get
desc: This allows you to get a value from in the set.
The reason this might be useful is if you want to retrieve something
from the set that will have the same hashcode but be in a different state
as the value you are passing in

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to get from the set

returns.desc: the value you wanted to get, null if it wasn't in the set

methods.name: clear
desc: This removes all values from inside the set

methods.name: isEmpty
desc: This allows you to check whether the set has no values

methods.name: toString
desc: This converts the set to a string and evaluating any collections inside it

returns.desc: the string representation of the set

methods.name: remove
desc: This allows you to remove a value from the set

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to remove from the set

returns.desc: whether the value was removed from the set

static_methods.name: unordered
desc: This creates an unordered set

static_methods.name: of
desc: This allows you to create a set with an arbitrary number of values

params.name: values...
params.desc: the values you want to add to the set

Map.name: Map
desc: This class cannot be constructed since it has a literal, `{}`

methods.name: getValues
desc: This allows you to get the values in the map

returns.desc: a complete list of all the values

methods.name: containsKey
desc: This allows you to check if the map contains a specific key

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to check

returns.desc: true if the map contains the key, false otherwise

methods.name: putAll
desc: This allows you to put all the keys and values of another map into this map

params.name: another map
params.desc: the map you want to merge into this map

methods.name: get
desc: This allows you to get the value of a key in the map

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to get the value of

returns.desc: the value of the key, will return null if non-existent

methods.name: isEmpty
desc: This allows you to check if the map is empty

returns.desc: true if the map is empty, false otherwise

methods.name: clear
desc: This allows you to clear the map of all the keys and values

methods.name: toString
desc: This allows you to get the string representation of the map and evaluating any collections inside it

returns.desc: the string representation of the map

methods.name: getKeys
desc: This allows you to get the keys in the map

returns.desc: a complete list of all the keys

methods.name: putIfAbsent
desc: This allows you to put a key and value in the map if it doesn't exist

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to put

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to put

returns.desc: the previous value associated with the key, null if none

methods.name: remove
desc: This allows you to remove a key and its value from the map

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to remove

returns.desc: the value associated with the key, null if none

methods.name: put
desc: This allows you to put a key and value in the map

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to put

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to put

returns.desc: the previous value associated with the key, null if none

static_methods.name: unordered
desc: This function allows you to create an unordered map

Null.name: Null
desc: This class cannot be constructed since null has a literal `null`.

Number.name: Number
desc: This class cannot be constructed as it has a literal representation. For math related functions see the Math class.

methods.name: isInfinite
desc: This allows you to check if a number is infinite

returns.desc: true if the number is infinite

methods.name: round
desc: This allows you to round a number to the nearest integer

methods.name: absolute
desc: This allows you to get the absolute value of a number

returns.desc: the absolute value of the number

methods.name: toDegrees
desc: This allows you to convert a number in radians to degrees

methods.name: toRadians
desc: This allows you to convert a number in degrees to radians

methods.name: ceil
desc: This allows you to round a number up to the nearest integer

methods.name: isNaN
desc: This allows you to check if a number is not a number

returns.desc: true if the number is not a number

methods.name: floor
desc: This allows you to round a number down to the nearest integer

methods.name: modulus
desc: This allows you to get the modulus of two numbers

params.name: otherNumber
params.desc: the divisor

returns.desc: the modulus of the two numbers

Thread.name: Thread
desc: This class allows you to create threads for asynchronous execution.

methods.name: getAge
desc: This gets the age of the thread in milliseconds

methods.name: isAlive
desc: This checks if the thread is alive (still running)

returns.desc: true if the thread is alive, false if not

methods.name: getName
desc: This gets the name of the thread

methods.name: stop
desc: This stops the thread from executing, anything that was running will be instantly stopped

static_methods.name: freeze
desc: This freezes the current thread, stops anything else from executing on the thread

static_methods.name: runThreaded
desc: This starts a new thread and runs a function on it, the thread will
terminate when it finishes executing the function, threads will stop automatically
when the program stops, you are also able to stop threads by using the Thread value

params.name: function
params.desc: the function you want to run on a new thread

static_methods.name: runThreaded
desc: This starts a new thread with a specific name and runs a function on it

params.name: name
params.desc: the name of the thread

params.name: function
params.desc: the function you want to run on a new thread

static_methods.name: getCurrentThread
desc: This gets the current thread that the code is running on
throws: Thread is not safe to get

File.name: File
desc: This class allows you to manipulate files.
This creates a new File object with set path

params.name: path
params.desc: the path of the file

methods.name: read
desc: This reads the file and returns the contents as a string
throws: There was an error reading the file: ...
Out of Memory - The file you are trying to read is too large

methods.name: getName
desc: This returns the name of the file

methods.name: getAbsolutePath
desc: This returns the absolute path of the file

returns.desc: the absolute path of the file

methods.name: getPath
desc: This returns the path of the file

methods.name: exists
desc: This returns if the file exists

methods.name: createDirectory
desc: This creates all parent directories of the file if they don't already exist

returns.desc: true if the directories were created

methods.name: getSubFiles
desc: This returns a list of all the sub files in the directory

returns.desc: a list of all the sub files in the directory

methods.name: delete
desc: This deletes the file

returns.desc: true if the file was deleted

methods.name: write
desc: This writes a string to a file

params.name: string
params.desc: the string to write to the file

throws: There was an error writing the file: ...

methods.name: open
desc: This opens the file (as in opens it on your os)

static_methods.name: getDirectory
desc: This returns the file of the working directory

returns.desc: the file of the working directory

Math.name: Math

static_members.name: e

static_members.name: pi
desc: The value of pi

static_methods.name: abs

returns.desc: the absolute value of the number

static_methods.name: min

Network.name: Network
desc: Allows you to do http requests. This is a utility class and cannot be constructed.

static_methods.name: downloadFile
desc: Downloads a file from an url to a file

params.name: url
params.desc: the url to download from

params.name: file
params.desc: the file to download to

static_methods.name: openUrl
desc: Opens an url in the default browser

params.name: url
params.desc: the url to open

static_methods.name: requestUrl
desc: Requests an url and returns the response

params.name: url
params.desc: the url to request

Collector.name: Collector
desc: This class is similar to Java streams, allowing for easy modifications of collections.

methods.name: flatten
desc: If there are values in the collector that are collections they will be expanded,
collections inside collections are not flattened, you would have to call this method again

returns.desc: a new Collector with the expanded values

methods.name: filter
desc: This filters the collection using the predicate

params.name: predicate
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns Boolean, true if it should be kept, false if not

methods.name: toSet
desc: This puts all the values in the collector into a set and returns it

returns.desc: a set with all the values in the collector

methods.name: forEach
desc: This iterates over all the values in the Collector and calls the passed in function with each value

params.name: function
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns nothing

methods.name: noneMatch
desc: This checks if none of the values in the collection match the predicate

params.name: predicate
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns Boolean, true if it matches, false if not

returns.desc: true if none of the values match the predicate, false if not

methods.name: toList
desc: This puts all the values in the collector into a list and returns it

returns.desc: a list with all the values in the collector

methods.name: map
desc: This maps the values in Collector to a new value

params.name: mapper
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns a new value

returns.desc: a new Collector with the mapped values

methods.name: allMatch
desc: This checks if all the values in the collection match the predicate

params.name: predicate
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns Boolean, true if it matches, false if not

returns.desc: true if all the values match the predicate, false if not

methods.name: anyMatch
desc: This checks if any of the values in the collection match the predicate

params.name: predicate
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns Boolean, true if it matches, false if not

returns.desc: true if any of the values match the predicate, false if not

static_methods.name: of
desc: This creates a collector for a collection

params.name: value...
params.desc: the values you want to evaluate

static_methods.name: of
desc: This creates a collector for a collection

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection of values you want to evaluate

static_methods.name: isCollection
desc: This checks if the value is a collection

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to check

returns.desc: true if the value is a collection

Java.name: Java
desc: This allows for direct interaction from Arucas to Java

methods.name: callMethod
deprecated: You should call the method directly on the value: Java.valueOf('').isBlank();
desc: This calls the specified method with the specified parameters, this is slower
than calling a delegate, this is the same speed as calling the method directly on the value however

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters...
params.desc: the parameters to call the method with, this may be none, a note - if you are calling a VarArgs method you must pass a Java Object array with your VarArg arguments

returns.desc: the return value of the method call wrapped in the Java wrapper

throws: No such method ... with ... parameters exists for ...
First parameter must be name of method

methods.name: setField
deprecated: You should assign the value directly on the value: Java.constructClass('me.senseiwells.impl.Test').A = 'Hello';
desc: This sets the specified field to the specified value

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: the name of the field

params.name: value
params.desc: the value to set the field to, the value type must match the type of the field

methods.name: getField
deprecated: You should call the method directly on the value: Java.constructClass('me.senseiwells.impl.Test').A;
desc: This returns the Java wrapped value of the specified field

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: the name of the field

returns.desc: the Java wrapped value of the field

methods.name: toArucas
desc: This converts the Java value to an Arucas Value

returns.desc: the Value in Arucas, this may still be of Java value if the value cannot be converted into an Arucas value, values like Strings, Numbers, Lists, etc... will be converted

methods.name: getMethodDelegate
desc: This returns a method delegate for the specified method name and parameters,
delegating the method is much faster since it uses MethodHandles, so if you are calling
a method repetitively it is faster to delegate the method and then call the delegate

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters
params.desc: the number of parameters

returns.desc: the function containing the Java method delegate

throws: No such method ... with ... parameters can be found

static_methods.name: floatOf
desc: Creates a Java value float, to be used in Java, since floats cannot be explicitly declared in Arucas

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java float

static_methods.name: shortOf
desc: Creates a Java value short, to be used in Java since shorts cannot be explicitly declared in Arucas

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java short

static_methods.name: classFromName
desc: Gets a Java class from the name of the class

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class you want to get

returns.desc: the Java Class<?> value wrapped in the Java wrapper

static_methods.name: longArray
desc: Creates a Java long array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only longs

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: supplierOf
desc: Creates a Java Supplier object from a given function

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed, this must have no parameters and must return (supply) a value

static_methods.name: functionOf
desc: Creates a Java Function object from a given function

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed, this must have one parameter and must return a value

static_methods.name: doubleOf
desc: Creates a Java value double, to be used in Java

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java double

static_methods.name: getStaticField
desc: Gets a static field Java value from a Java class

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: the name of the field

returns.desc: the Java value of the field wrapped in the Java wrapper

static_methods.name: constructClass
desc: This constructs a Java class with specified class name and parameters

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: parameters...
params.desc: any parameters to pass to the constructor, there may be no parameters, again if calling VarArgs constructor you must have your VarArg parameters in a Java Object array

returns.desc: the constructed Java Object wrapped in the Java wrapper

throws: First parameter must be a class name
No such constructor with ... parameters exists for ...

static_methods.name: shortArray
desc: Creates a Java short array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only shorts

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: runnableOf
desc: Creates a Java Runnable object from a given function

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed, this must have no parameters and any return values will be ignored

static_methods.name: charOf
desc: Creates a Java value char, to be used in Java since chars cannot be explicitly declared in Arucas

params.name: string
params.desc: the string with one character to convert to a Java char

static_methods.name: charArray
desc: Creates a Java char array with a given size, the array is filled with �'s
(null characters) by default and can be filled with only chars

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: intOf
desc: Creates a Java value int, to be used in Java since ints cannot be explicitly declared in Arucas

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java int

static_methods.name: floatArray
desc: Creates a Java float array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only floats

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: booleanArray
desc: Creates a Java boolean array with a given size, the array is filled with false
by default and can be filled with only booleans

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: doubleArray
desc: Creates a Java double array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only doubles

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: byteOf
desc: Creates a Java value byte, to be used in Java since bytes cannot be explicitly declared in Arucas

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java byte

static_methods.name: valueOf
desc: Converts any Arucas value into a Java value then wraps it in the Java wrapper and returns it

params.name: value
params.desc: any value to get the Java value of

static_methods.name: byteArray
desc: Creates a Java byte array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only bytes

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: longOf
desc: Creates a Java value long, to be used in Java since longs cannot be explicitly declared in Arucas

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java long

static_methods.name: arrayOf
desc: Creates a Java Object array with a given values, this will be the size of the array,
again this cannot be used to create primitive arrays

params.name: values...
params.desc: the values to add to the array

static_methods.name: arrayWithSize
desc: Creates a Java Object array with a given size, the array is filled with null values
by default and can be filled with any Java values, this array cannot be expanded

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: booleanOf
desc: Creates a Java value boolean, to be used in Java

params.name: bool
params.desc: the boolean to convert to a Java boolean

static_methods.name: intArray
desc: Creates a Java int array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only ints

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: callStaticMethod
desc: Calls a static method of a Java class, this is slower than delegating a method, but better for a one off call

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters...
params.desc: any parameters to call the method with, this can be none, a note - if you are calling a VarArg method then you must have your VarArg parameters in a Java Object array

returns.desc: the return value of the method wrapped in the Java wrapper

throws: First parameter must be a class name and the second parameter must be a method name
No such method ... with ... parameters exists for ...

static_methods.name: setStaticField
desc: Sets a static field in a Java class with a new value, the type of the new value needs to match the type of the field,
you can pass in Java wrapped values to guarantee type matching, they will be unwrapped, regular values will be converted

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: the name of the field

params.name: newValue
params.desc: the new value

examples:
// Obviously this won't work, but it's just an example
Java.setStaticField('java.lang.Integer', 'MAX_VALUE', Java.intOf(100));"

static_methods.name: getStaticMethodDelegate
desc: Gets a static method delegate from a Java class, delegating the method is much faster than directly calling it since it uses MethodHandles,
if you are repetitively calling a static method you should delegate it and call that delegate

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters
params.desc: the number of parameters

returns.desc: the delegated Java method in an Arucas Function

throws: No such method ... with ... parameters can be found

static_methods.name: consumerOf
desc: Creates a Java Consumer object from a given function

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed, this must have one parameter and any return values will be ignored, the parameter type is unknown at compile time

Json.name: Json
desc: This class allows you to create and manipulate JSON objects.

methods.name: writeToFile
desc: This writes the Json to a file

params.name: file
params.desc: the file that you want to write to

throws: There was an error writing the file: ...

methods.name: getValue
desc: This converts the Json back into a Value

returns.desc: the Value parsed from the Json

static_methods.name: fromMap
desc: This converts a map into a Json, an important thing to note is that
any values that are not Numbers, Booleans, Lists, Maps, or Null will use their
toString() member to convert them to a string

params.name: map
params.desc: the map that you want to parse into a Json

returns.desc: the Json parsed from the map

static_methods.name: fromList
desc: This converts a list into a Json, an important thing to note is that
any values that are not Numbers, Booleans, Lists, Maps, or Null will use their
toString() member to convert them to a string

params.name: list
params.desc: the list that you want to parse into a Json

returns.desc: the Json parsed from the list

static_methods.name: fromString
desc: This converts a string into a Json provided it is formatted correctly

params.name: string
params.desc: the string that you want to parse into a Json

returns.desc: the Json parsed from the string
